headline: Health Advisers Support Birth Control Patch
snippet: The Food and Drug Administration’s panel of reproductive health experts voted that the benefits of Ortho Evra outweigh its risks, like a potentially higher likelihood of blood clots.

headline: Battling Over Birth Control
snippet: The White House should not wobble on requiring free contraceptive coverage in health insurance plans.

headline: Battling Over Birth Control
snippet: The White House should not wobble on requiring free contraceptive coverage in health insurance plans.

headline: Democrats Urge Obama to Protect Contraceptive Coverage in Health Plans
snippet: Roman Catholic bishops, charities, schools and universities are seeking a broad exemption for employers who object to covering free birth control for women for moral and religious reasons.

headline: The Religious Exemption on Birth Control Coverage
snippet: The Catholic bishops, a laywoman and the Center for Reproductive Rights respond to an editorial.

headline: The Religious Exemption on Birth Control Coverage
snippet: The Catholic bishops, a laywoman and the Center for Reproductive Rights respond to an editorial.

headline: Romney Attacked On Birth Control
snippet: President Obama's re-election campaign has been hammering Mitt Romney from many angles in recent weeks. And now Democrats are beginning a new push against him, this time using the issue of reproductive rights in a bid to raise doubts about Mr. Romney...

headline: The Birth Control Solution
snippet: Family planning is crucial to solving poverty, climate change and other issues. And don’t worry: contraceptives don’t cause sex.

headline: Calls for Free Coverage for Birth Control
snippet: Readers respond to an Op-Ed on making birth control affordable to prevent unintended pregnancy.

headline: Calls for Free Coverage for Birth Control
snippet: Readers respond to an Op-Ed on making birth control affordable to prevent unintended pregnancy.

headline: Make Birth Control Affordable
snippet: Health insurers continue to charge fees that make it difficult, and sometimes impossible, for women to prevent unintended pregnancy. That could soon change.

headline: Make Birth Control Affordable
snippet: Health insurers continue to charge fees that make it difficult, and sometimes impossible, for women to prevent unintended pregnancy. That could soon change.

headline: Childbirth: Wait to Restart the Pill, C.D.C. Says
snippet: Women who have just given birth should wait at least three weeks before they start using birth control pills because of the risk of deep-vein thrombosis, public health officials announced last week.

headline: U.S. Orders Review of Risks of Some Birth Control Pills
snippet: The review will focus on the hormone drospirenone, which is found in Bayer’s Yaz, Yasmin, Beyaz and Safyral products.

headline: U.S. Orders Review of Risks Of Some Birth Control Pills
snippet: The review will focus on the hormone drospirenone, which is found in Bayer’s Yaz, Yasmin, Beyaz and Safyral products.

headline: Goslings Defy Prospect Park's Birth Control Effort
snippet: Four from a treated nest on an island in the park's Upper Pool have been spotted paddling behind their mother.

headline: Report Details Sabotage of Birth Control
snippet: Men who abuse women physically and emotionally may also sabotage their partners’ birth control, pressuring them to become pregnant against their will, new reports suggest.

headline: Report Details Sabotage of Birth Control
snippet: Men who abuse women physically and emotionally may also sabotage their partners’ birth control, pressuring them to become pregnant against their will, new reports suggest.

headline: Officials Consider Requiring Insurers to Offer Free Contraceptives
snippet: The Obama administration is examining whether the new health care law can be used to require insurance plans to offer contraceptives and other family planning services to women free of charge.

headline: Birth Control Update, in Thousands of Interviews
snippet: Researchers conducted 80-minute interviews of 7,356 women ages 15 to 44 to get the latest on birth control.

headline: Birth Control Update, in Thousands of Interviews
snippet: Researchers conducted 80-minute interviews of 7,356 women ages 15 to 44 to get the latest on birth control.

headline: Solution to Crowded Schools? How About Birth Control?
snippet: In reference to the issue of school overcrowding, Cathleen Black, the schools chancellor, makes an off-handed joke that some didn't appreciate.
